Articles.Content:
Some very long time ago I used to spend my time playing the very first Elite. It had awful graphics (by today's standards):

but it was so addicting that I used to spend a lot of time with it. I skipped all the sequels (Frontiers, First encounter, etc) but now I watched a gameplay video from the new Elite: Dangerous and felt a pang of nostalgia.

My question is - is it worth buying it or am I going to be disappointed?

No idea myself. Elite was, pretty boring for me. I liked the concept, but it felt like a grind. Go to one star and hope there's not a pirate...

I think it would be better if the game had more of a difficulty CURVE, and not a difficulty sine graph...

But that's just me...

I think Dangerous will be better with that kind of stuff, though.

But you know what's interesting? Frontier and First Encounters had realistic Solar Systems! Procedurally generated. I would like to know how....

But you know what's interesting? Frontier and First Encounters had realistic Solar Systems! Procedurally generated. I would like to know how....

That's not a very hard thing to do. I think the whole solar system can be described by only a handful of figures (radius, mass, distance from the star, etc). You get a seed number from random number generator and then some math formulas to derive all of the above. So, in order to re-create this system you only have to know the initial seed.

Anyhow, I made a thread about it.

Already a thread about the game:

http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/87612-The-Elite-Dangerous-thread
I recently bought it, and being my biggest game purchase ever, I say it's worth it. It will be even better when more content is added.
I am a beta backer, but I did not play since release, as I waited until they get enough developers for continuous updates. I will start playing again in two days, as 1.2 will be out.

Looks expensive as heck.

Last I checked it was thirty bucks?

Seems like a cool game, but... I'm cheap...
